title: For this reason, it is unfortunate that the Employment Non-Discrimination Act (ENDA), as introduced in Congress several times between 1994 and 2014, included a religious exemption that was much broader than that contained in Title VII—it categorically exempted religious organizations from any obligation not to discriminate in employment matters on the basis of sexual orientation and gender identity.
